description:
Create a modern landing page for curious.ai - a news curation platform. The page should have:

1. A clean navbar with the curious.ai logo/name on the left and Login/Sign Up buttons on the right

2. A hero section with:
   - Headline: 'Your Personal News Intelligence'
   - Subheadline explaining how the app curates news from multiple sources using AI
   - A CTA button 'Get Started' that links to signup

3. A brief features section (3-4 cards) highlighting:
   - Multi-source aggregation (Twitter, RSS feeds)
   - AI-powered curation with Gemini
   - Voice narration of news summaries
   - Smart clustering of related stories

4. A minimal footer with copyright curious.ai 2026

Use a clean, modern design with a light theme. Primary color should be a vibrant purple/indigo similar to the nBot reference. Keep it simple and elegant - this is a demo.

Create a complete authentication system with the following pages:

1. SIGNUP PAGE (/signup):
   - Email input field with validation
   - Password input field with strength indicator
   - Confirm password field
   - 'Sign Up with Email' button
   - 'Continue with Google' button (OAuth integration placeholder - will show a styled button)
   - Link to login page at bottom: 'Already have an account? Log in'
   - Form validation with error messages

2. LOGIN PAGE (/login):
   - Email input field
   - Password input field
   - 'Log In' button
   - 'Continue with Google' button
   - 'Forgot Password?' link (can be placeholder)
   - Link to signup: 'Don't have an account? Sign up'

3. PROFILE PAGE (/profile):
   - User avatar/initial
   - User email display
   - 'My Curators' section showing a list of saved curators (hardcoded for demo: 'AI & Tech News', 'Sports Updates', 'Global Politics')
   - Each curator shows name, date created, and sources used
   - 'Create New Curator' button that links to /curator page
   - Logout button

Use the same design language as the landing page. Store user session in localStorage for the demo. The navbar should update to show user avatar/name when logged in instead of Login/Sign Up buttons.

Create the main CURATOR PAGE (/curator) - this is the core functionality page. Reference the design from /home/user/Attachments/158abf09-1522-4126-8908-e1bd868d871b.jpeg for the layout.

The page should have:

1. HEADER:
   - Same navbar as other pages
   - Main title: 'What do you want to follow?'

2. PROMPT INPUT:
   - Large text input area with placeholder 'Tell me a topic, trend, or interest...'
   - Arrow/submit button on the right side of the input
   - Below the input, show suggestion chips/pills like: 'AI startup funding news', 'Cricket highlights', 'Geopolitics analysis', 'Health & wellness'

3. SOURCE SELECTION SECTION:
   - Text: 'or add a source directly'
   - Two clickable source cards in a row:
     a) X/Twitter card with Twitter icon
     b) RSS Feed card with RSS icon
   - When user clicks Twitter card, show a modal/popup with 3 hardcoded Twitter accounts to select:
     * @TechGuru_AI (avatar, handle, bio: 'AI researcher and tech enthusiast')
     * @AINewsDaily (avatar, handle, bio: 'Your daily dose of AI updates')
     * @GlobalPulse (avatar, handle, bio: 'World news and analysis')
   - Each account has a checkbox to select/deselect
   - When user clicks RSS card, show a modal with 3 hardcoded RSS sources:
     * TechCrunch AI (https://techcrunch.com/ai/feed)
     * ESPN Sports (https://espn.com/rss/news)
     * Reuters World (https://reuters.com/world/feed)
   - Each RSS source has a checkbox to select/deselect
   - Selected sources should show as pills/tags below the source cards

4. GENERATE BUTTON:
   - A prominent 'Generate News Feed' button that becomes active when user has entered a prompt
   - This button will navigate to /results page (functionality to be added later)

Store selected sources and prompt in state. Use the same design language - light theme, clean cards, the gradient accents.

Create hardcoded test data for the demo. Create the following data structures:

1. TWITTER USERS AND TWEETS:

User 1 - @TechGuru_AI:
- Tweet 1 (AI topic): 'OpenAI just announced GPT-5 with revolutionary reasoning capabilities. Early benchmarks show 40% improvement over GPT-4 Turbo. The AI race heats up! #AI #OpenAI'
- Tweet 2 (AI topic): 'Anthropic raises $4B at $60B valuation. Claude's enterprise adoption is driving incredible growth. The AI infrastructure battle is real.'
- Tweet 3 (Cricket topic): 'India vs Australia Test series has been absolutely thrilling! Kohli's comeback century in Melbourne shows why he's still the best. #Cricket #INDvAUS'

User 2 - @AINewsDaily:
- Tweet 1 (AI topic): 'Google DeepMind's new Gemini 2.0 is setting new standards in multimodal AI. The ability to natively process video, audio, and text simultaneously is game-changing.'
- Tweet 2 (AI topic): 'Breaking: Microsoft announces $50B investment in AI data centers across Europe. The cloud AI infrastructure race is intensifying.'
- Tweet 3 (AI topic): 'Meta's Llama 4 leaked benchmarks suggest it may finally match GPT-4 in reasoning. Open-source AI closing the gap fast.'

User 3 - @GlobalPulse:
- Tweet 1 (Geopolitics topic): 'US-China tech tensions escalate as new semiconductor export restrictions announced. Chip wars entering a critical phase. #Geopolitics #Tech'
- Tweet 2 (Cricket topic): 'ICC announces expansion of T20 World Cup to 24 teams. Cricket's global footprint continues to grow with new markets in Americas.'
- Tweet 3 (Health topic): 'WHO releases new guidelines on AI-assisted diagnostics. Machine learning showing 95% accuracy in early cancer detection. Revolutionary times for healthcare.'

2. RSS FEEDS WITH 7 ARTICLES EACH (store as array of article objects):

TechCrunch AI Feed - 7 articles on various AI topics
ESPN Sports Feed - 7 articles on sports (mix of cricket, football, etc.)
Reuters World Feed - 7 articles on geopolitics and world news

Each article should have:
- id, title, summary (250 words), content, source, publishedDate, imageUrl (use placeholder images from picsum.photos with different seeds)

Store all this data in a data file that can be imported by the curator page.

Create a backend API route to fetch news from Gemini AI. The API should:

1. Create an API endpoint at /api/gemini-news that accepts POST requests with:
   - query: string (the user's topic/prompt)

2. The API should call Google's Gemini 2.0 Flash model using the Gemini API with:
   - GEMINI_API_KEY: AIzaSyCG1-rWb9owg3YZgptBrxFnO-5deBZiQAk
   - Use the model 'gemini-2.0-flash' (not gemini-3-flash)
   - Enable grounding with Google Search to get real-time news

3. The prompt to Gemini should be:
   'You are a news aggregator. Search for and provide the top 10 most recent and relevant news articles about: [USER_QUERY]. 
   For each article, provide:
   - title: A headline for the article
   - summary: A comprehensive 300-word summary of the news
   - source: The news source name
   - publishedDate: When it was published
   - url: The source URL if available
   
   Return the response as a valid JSON array of article objects. Focus on the most recent and breaking news.'

4. Parse the Gemini response and return structured JSON with the articles

5. Handle errors gracefully and return appropriate error responses

The API will be called from the frontend when user submits a query on the curator page.

Create the RESULTS PAGE (/results) that displays clustered news cards. Reference the design from /home/user/Attachments/7157dea8-5836-448a-82d7-976a695ff8e0.jpeg for the card layout.

The page should:

1. LAYOUT:
   - Left sidebar showing:
     * 'For You' section at top (highlighted)
     * 'AI CURATORS' section listing the current query as a curator
     * '+ New AI Curator' button linking to /curator
   - Main content area showing the clustered news cards
   - Right sidebar with 'For You' heading, description 'Your personalized content from all curators', and RSS icon

2. NEWS CLUSTERING LOGIC:
   - When page loads, retrieve the prompt and selected sources from URL params or state
   - Fetch news from Gemini API using the prompt
   - Filter relevant tweets from selected Twitter accounts based on topic matching
   - Filter relevant articles from selected RSS feeds based on topic matching
   - Cluster related news items together using simple keyword/topic matching (group items about same topic)
   - Each cluster represents one story/topic with multiple sources

3. NEWS CARDS (for each cluster):
   - Card with white background, subtle shadow
   - At top: cluster/topic name with time ago (e.g., '6h ago')
   - Main image from one of the articles in the cluster
   - Bold headline/title of the main story
   - Summary text (expandable with 'Show more' link)
   - NARRATION BUTTON: A speaker/audio icon button labeled 'Listen' - clicking this should trigger text-to-speech (Sarvam integration to be added)
   - Sources section at bottom showing icons/names of sources (Twitter handles, RSS feed names) that contributed to this cluster

4. At bottom of main area: Input field 'Ask about your For You feed...' with send button

5. LOADING STATE: Show skeleton loaders while fetching and processing news

The clustering should be simple for the demo - group by topic keywords (AI, cricket, geopolitics, health, etc.)

Integrate Sarvam AI Text-to-Speech API for the narration feature on the results page. Replace the current Web Speech API with Sarvam AI.

1. Create an API endpoint at /api/sarvam-tts that:
   - Accepts POST requests with: text (the narration script)
   - Calls Sarvam AI TTS API using:
     * API Key: sk_i8amxjz9_MdARpKfvIofS4VI6vXSya5Lq
     * Endpoint: https://api.sarvam.ai/text-to-speech
     * Headers: 'api-subscription-key' for authentication
     * Body parameters:
       - inputs: [text]
       - target_language_code: 'en-IN'
       - speaker: 'meera' (Indian English female voice)
       - pace: 1.3
       - speech_sample_rate: 22050
       - enable_preprocessing: true
       - model: 'bulbul:v2'
   - Returns the base64 encoded audio in the response

2. Update the Results page Listen button to:
   - When clicked, call the /api/sarvam-tts endpoint with the cluster summary as text
   - Show a loading spinner on the button while generating audio
   - When audio is returned, decode the base64 and play it using the Audio API
   - Show a stop button while audio is playing
   - Handle errors gracefully (show toast message if TTS fails)

3. For each cluster, generate a narration script that includes:
   - The main headline
   - A brief summary of the story
   - The sources that reported on it

Fix and improve the curator page flow to properly pass data to the results page:

1. When user clicks 'Generate News Feed' button on the curator page:
   - Save the prompt, selected Twitter accounts, and selected RSS feeds to localStorage
   - Navigate to /results page with URL search params: ?prompt=<encoded_prompt>

2. Update the curator page Twitter modal:
   - The current @TechGuru_AI, @AINewsDaily, @GlobalPulse accounts should match the mock data
   - Show follower count for each account
   - Selected accounts should be visually highlighted

3. Update the curator page RSS modal:
   - Show the 3 RSS feeds: TechCrunch AI, ESPN Sports, Reuters World
   - Match the feeds in the mock data
   - Selected feeds should be visually highlighted

4. Make sure the selected sources pills below the source cards are clickable to remove them

5. The suggestion chips should include topics that match our mock data: 'AI developments', 'Cricket news', 'Global geopolitics', 'Health tech'

6. Add form validation - show a subtle error if user tries to generate without entering a prompt

Improve the results page clustering and display:

1. Fix the clustering logic to better group related content:
   - Group Gemini API results with matching tweets and RSS articles by topic
   - Use keyword matching: if an item contains 'AI', 'artificial intelligence', 'GPT', 'machine learning' etc., group them together in an 'AI' cluster
   - Similarly for 'cricket', 'sports', 'geopolitics', 'health' topics

2. For each cluster card, ensure:
   - The main image is displayed prominently at the top
   - The headline is the title from the representative article (the one with most content)
   - The summary combines information from multiple sources
   - Sources section shows all contributing sources with appropriate icons:
     * Twitter icon + handle for tweets
     * RSS icon + feed name for RSS articles
     * Google/Gemini icon + 'AI Search' for Gemini results

3. Generate a proper narration script for each cluster that reads naturally:
   - 'Here's the latest on [topic]. [Main headline]. [Brief 2-3 sentence summary]. This story was reported by [list sources].'

4. Add visual indicators:
   - Number of articles in each cluster (e.g., '5 articles')
   - Time of most recent article
   - Topic tag/badge (AI, Cricket, Politics, etc.)

5. If no sources are selected or no relevant content found, show a helpful empty state with suggestions
